titles.title: A bill to authorize the President to award a gold medal on behalf of Congress honoring Wilma G. Rudolph, in recognition of her enduring contributions to humanity and women's athletics in the United States and the world.

A bill to authorize the President to award a gold medal on behalf of Congress honoring Wilma G. Rudolph, in recognition of her enduring contributions to humanity and women's athletics in the United States and the world.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: Authorizes the President to award a congressional gold medal honoring Wilma G. Rudolph (three-time gold medal winner in the 1960 Olympics) to her family in recognition of her outstanding and enduring contributions to humanity and to women's athletics.
